page.title: 06ECOLOGY LANDSCAPE FARMING
page.content: The number of miles of hedges which have been removed is constantly quoted. In some places one or two full grown trees indicate the line of what was once a hedgerow. The butterfly, and other animal populations are in decline. An argument exists. Some say that spraying with chemicals is the cause, though I have seen 'evidence' by "Shell" showing that various species' decline are related, statistically, to the removal of the habitat of the animal, the hedge and its associated strip of grass, together with trees and shrubs. The removal of animal habitats causing the disappearance of a group of species, breaks the food chain, causing imbalances in traditional populations. The tractors now are enormous and expensive.
